text: M-CSF - dependent PKC Regulates NF-kappaB - targeted Genes
NF-kappaB induces a number of downstream genes , including the IkappaB family .
Among the IkappaB molecules , <extra_id_0> IkappaBalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is highly induced by NF-kappaB activation [ 40 ] .
Having shown that PKC regulated NF-kappaB activity in M-CSF - stimulated MDMs , we next determined whether inhibition of PKC activity decreased expression of NF-kappaB - regulated genes .
We treated both MDMs and RAW 264.7 cells with the PKC inhibitor Ro-31-8220 for 30 minutes and then stimulated with M-CSF .
<extra_id_0> IkappaBalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene was measured by qRT-PCR .

As shown in Figures 6A and 6B , M-CSF enhanced <extra_id_0> IkappaBalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression and PKC inhibition by Ro-31-8220 decreased <extra_id_0> IkappaBalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression in both MDMs and RAW 264.7 cells ( p < 0.01 ) , demonstrating that PKC affected NF-kappaB - regulated gene expression in macrophages .

text: To further define the role of PKC in mediating human MDM survival in response to M-CSF , we examined the expression of the anti-apoptotic gene <extra_id_0> BCL-xL <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , which is also regulated by NF-kappaB .
